sources.data_found: bg14: AMD 64C/128T 3.7GHz, 2TB @2933MHz, 8× A40 48GB GDDR6 in 4× NVLINK3 pairs; bg15: AMD 64C/128T 3.25GHz, 1.5TB @4800MHz, 1× H100 NVL 94GB HBM3; th121-{1–12}: RTX A5000 24GB render GPU; th121-{13–24}: RTX 5000 Ada 32GB render GPU
William & Mary has a total enrollment of 9,762 including 6,963 undergraduate students and 2,799 graduate students
1/3 of the computer science majors at W&M are women (much higher than the national average)! #16 Top Public Colleges for Tech Salaries (The Wall Street Journal 2024)

In 2024 – just five years after the major's launch – 42 students graduated with data science as their first major and 10 with it as their second. Data science minor is now the most popular at the university
The Department of Computer Science offers an undergraduate major leading to a B.S. or a B.A. degree and a graduate program leading to M.S. and Ph.D. degrees

student_data.notes: CS enrollment estimated based on: (1) W&M CS department states '1/3 of CS majors are women' (higher than national average ~20%), suggesting a robust program; (2) Total undergraduate enrollment is 6,963 (2023-24); (3) Data science had 52 graduates in 2024 (42 primary + 10 secondary majors), showing strong computing interest; (4) CS ranked #16 for tech salaries among public colleges. Estimated ~5% of undergrads in CS (typical for mid-size universities) = 350 students. Graduate programs (MS/PhD) estimated at typical 20-25% of undergraduate size = 125 total, split as 80 MS and 45 PhD based on typical ratios.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Astral subcluster: 1 node × 8 A30 GPUs = 8 total A30 GPUs
CS Department: th121-{1–12} workstations each with 1 RTX A5000 = 12 total
CS Department: th121-{13–24} workstations each with 1 RTX 5000 Ada = 12 total

gpu_resources.notes:
GPU RESOURCES CALCULATION:

1) CS Department Resources (support.cs.wm.edu):
   - bg14: 8× A40 48GB = 8 A40
   - bg15: 1× H100 NVL 94GB = 1 H100
   - th121-{1–12}: 12 workstations × 1 RTX A5000 24GB each = 12 RTX A5000
   - th121-{13–24}: 12 workstations × 1 RTX 5000 Ada 32GB each = 12 RTX 5000 Ada

2) SciClone HPC Clusters:
   - Astral subcluster: 1 node × 8 A30 24GB = 8 A30
   - Gulf subcluster: 4 nodes × 2 A40 each = 8 A40

TOTAL COUNTS:
- H100: 1 (H100 NVL variant counted as H100 SXM)
- A40: 8 (CS bg14) + 8 (Gulf) = 16
- A30: 8 (Astral) - listed in other_high_vram_gpus
- RTX A5000: 12 - listed in other_high_vram_gpus
- RTX 5000 Ada: 12 - listed in other_high_vram_gpus

Note: SciClone/Chesapeake combined have 360 TFLOPS but detailed GPU inventory not publicly available beyond specific subclusters found.

analysis_notes: William & Mary operates SciClone and Chesapeake HPC clusters with 360 TFLOPS combined performance. GPU resources are modest compared to larger research universities, with only 1 H100, 16 A40s, and various professional visualization GPUs. CS department appears healthy with strong rankings (#16 for tech salaries among publics) and 1/3 female enrollment (well above national average). Data science program growth (most popular minor) indicates strong computing interest on campus.
